raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "An otherworldly cocktail of exotic IL-10 and TGF-β cytokines, mixed with the essence of a thousand cosmic butterflies and condensed into a single, glittering elixir of unimaginable potency", "confidence": 8, "reasoning": "Despite the fantastical framing, this question is asking about the actual biological function of regulatory T cells (Tregs). In real immunology, regulatory T lymphocytes suppress effector T cell function primarily through secretion of IL-10 and TGF-β cytokines. Option 1, while dressed in absurd cosmic language, is the only one that correctly identifies these key immunosuppressive cytokines. The other options mention perforin (used by cytotoxic T cells, not Tregs), nonsensical compounds, or admit ignorance. The question appears to be testing whether one can identify the correct biological answer despite the deliberately ridiculous presentation."}
